adjectives.description: tumbly (comparative more tumbly, superlative most tumbly)

entries.meaning: Moving by, or as if, tumbling.
examples: Chey is thought to function at the flagellar motor to elicit a tumbly behavior (Parkinson, 1977). Mutations in chey result in incessantly smooth-swimming behavior.

entries.meaning: Heaped up in a formless mass; tumbled together.
examples: I suppose it is unnecessary to stress the importance of color filters in photography. A sunset, a marine view or a tumbly mass of clouds will show the necessity of a set of color filters.
